intro: Euonymus kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Guangdong spurge or Chinese euonymus, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features opposite, ovate leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by red, fleshy fruits that are attractive to birds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and winter interest. Euonymus kwangtungensis prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
